item.title: 熊队寻求离开芝加哥，3.56 亿美元的债务却挥之不去
item.description: 对于芝加哥来说，熊队打算放弃他们称作家已超过一个世纪的小镇，这已经够糟糕的了。【原文：For Chicago, it was bad enough that the Bears are planning to abandon the town they’ve called home for more than a century.】

item.title: 加拿大安大略省承诺出资数十亿美元建造七国集团首批小型模块化反应堆
item.description: 加拿大政府和安大略省政府正在投资 30 亿加元（21 亿美元）建造他们期望成为七国集团国家中首个小型模块化反应堆的项目。【原文：The Canadian and Ontario governments are investing C$3 billion ($2.1 billion) to build what they expect to be the first small modular reactors in a Group of Seven country.】

item.title: 巴西央行前官员称降息遥遥无期
item.description: 据经济学家和前决策者称，巴西央行可能会将期待已久的降息进一步推迟到2026年，因为该机构正在独自与通货膨胀作斗争。【原文：Brazil’s central bank could delay its long-awaited interest rate cuts further into 2026 given the institution is waging a solo fight against inflation, according to economists and former policymakers.】

item.title: 英国推出紧急住房计划促进伦敦发展
item.description: 英国住房、社区和地方政府部（Ministry of Housing Communities and Local Government）已确认将采取一揽子措施，以促进伦敦在新开发项目崩溃后的住房建设。【原文：The UK’s Ministry of Housing Communities and Local Government has confirmed a package of measures designed to boost housebuilding in London following a collapse in new development.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数上涨，能源行业攀升；科技行业盈利不佳拖累指数上涨
item.description: 受能源和材料公司提振，美国股市周四开盘小幅上涨。特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc）、国际商业机器公司（International Business Machines Corp）和莫利纳医疗保健公司（Molina Healthcare Inc）等一系列公司令人失望的业绩抵消了涨幅。由于油价飙升加剧了通胀压力，10 年期国债收益率攀升也对股市造成了冲击。【原文：US stocks opened with slight gains on Thursday, boosted by energy and materials companies. Disappointing corporate results from a range of firms, including Tesla Inc., International Business Machines Corp. and Molina Healthcare Inc. offset gains. Equities were also stung by climbing yields on 10-year Treasuries as oil prices surged, adding to inflation pressure.】

item.title: 私人信贷开始牺牲保密性以吸引零售现金
item.description: 就在几年前，这对大多数私人信贷经理来说几乎是不可想象的：每月更新投资组合的价值。【原文：It would have seemed almost unthinkable for most private credit managers just a few years ago: Updating the value of their portfolios on a monthly basis.】

item.title: MercadoLibre 和 Casas Bahia 建立电子商务合作伙伴关系
item.description: 随着 MercadoLibre 公司与巴伊亚集团（Grupo Casas Bahia SA）联手推动该地区最大经济体巴西的电子商务发展，拉丁美洲数字市场的竞争进入了一个新阶段。【原文：Competition in Latin America’s digital market has entered a new phase as MercadoLibre Inc. joins forces with Grupo Casas Bahia SA to boost e-commerce in Brazil, the region’s largest economy.】

item.title: 米莱关键投票前阿根廷债券和比索反弹
item.description: 周四，阿根廷债券在六个交易日中仅第二次上涨，而比索在本周末关键的中期选举前连续第二天走强。【原文：Argentine bonds gained for only the second time in six sessions on Thursday, while the peso strengthened for a second day ahead of crucial midterm elections this weekend.】

item.title: 金银暴跌后黄金支持 ETF 买家退却
item.description: 由于担心金价涨势过快过猛，本周金价大幅下跌，黄金支持交易所交易基金的买家也随之撤退。【原文：Buyers of gold-backed exchange-traded funds retreated as bullion posted steep losses this week on concerns that the price rally had gone too fast, too far.】

item.title: 高盛推出旨在模仿私募股权投资回报的 ETF
item.description: 高盛资产管理公司（Goldman Sachs Asset Management）与摩根斯坦利资本国际公司（MSCI Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Asset Management is teaming up with MSCI Inc. to launch an exchange-traded fund that aims to deliver returns similar to that of a private equity portfolio.】

item.title: 阿根廷人为何在比索危机中转向加密货币？
item.description: 随着哈维尔-米莱伊总统在中期选举前收紧货币管制以支撑比索，像鲁本-洛佩斯这样的阿根廷人开始转向加密货币来保护自己的储蓄。【原文：As President Javier Milei tightens currency controls to prop up the peso ahead of midterm elections, Argentines like Ruben López are turning to cryptocurrencies to protect their savings.】

item.title: 亚马逊在美国为犹豫不决者推出新的人工智能购物工具
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）正在推出一款由人工智能驱动的新工具，当购物者感到无从选择时，该工具会推荐特定的产品。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is rolling out a new AI-powered tool that will recommend a specific product when shoppers are feeling overwhelmed with options.】

item.title: 潘兴广场出售七年后到期的高等级债券
item.description: 比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）的潘兴广场控股有限公司（Pershing Square Holdings Ltd.）将出售七年期美元债券，这是周四美国投资级一级市场上唯一的一次发行。【原文：Bill Ackman’s Pershing Square Holdings Ltd. is selling a seven-year dollar-denominated bond, the only offering in the US investment-grade primary market on Thursday.】

item.title: 汽车销售助加拿大零售业在美国贸易战中保持不败
item.description: 由于美国对汽车行业征收关税，购物者继续涌向汽车经销商，加拿大第三季度零售销售额小幅增长。【原文：Canadian retail sales increased modestly in the third quarter as shoppers continued to flock to car dealerships amid US tariffs on the auto sector.】

item.title: 英国零售商应对犯罪浪潮，店铺盗窃罪上升 13
item.description: 截至 2025 年 6 月的一年里，英格兰和威尔士的商店盗窃犯罪率上升了 13%，英国零售商正在努力应对日益严重的店内犯罪浪潮。【原文：Shoplifting offenses in England and Wales rose 13% in the year ended June 2025, as British retailers grapple with a worsening wave of in-store crime.】

item.title: 墨西哥通胀在墨西哥银行下次利率决定前放缓
item.description: 墨西哥 10 月上半月的年度通胀率放缓幅度超过预期，这可能为决策者在 11 月初的央行利率会议上延长宽松周期提供了空间。【原文：Mexico’s annual inflation slowed more than expected in the first half of October, likely giving policymakers’ room to extend their easing cycle at the central bank’s early November interest rate meeting.】

item.title: 普拉达销售额上升，提振奢侈品行业复苏希望
item.description: 由于对 Miu Miu 品牌的强劲需求抵消了集团同名品牌销售额的下滑，普拉达公司（Prada SpA）今年前九个月的销售额有所增长。【原文：Prada SpA sales rose in the first nine months of year as solid demand for its Miu Miu brand offset a fall at the group’s eponymous label.】

item.title: 新加坡 Grab 支持 May Mobility 推进机器人出租车计划
item.description: 东南亚最大的打车和送货公司 Grab Holdings Ltd. 正在支持无人驾驶技术开发商 May Mobility Inc.【原文：Grab Holdings Ltd., Southeast Asia’s largest ride-hailing and delivery company, is backing driverless technology developer May Mobility Inc. with the goal of bringing robotaxis to the region as soon as 2026.】

item.title: SPAC 回来了，MAGA 正在推动其发展
item.description:
自特朗普上台以来，数以百计的空头支票公司如雨后春笋般涌现，其中许多都与特朗普的议程不谋而合。【原文：

Hundreds of the blank-check companies have sprouted since Trump’s return to office, and many of them dovetail with his agenda.

】

item.title: 410 亿美元债务狂潮使墨西哥成为新兴市场头号借款国
item.description: 在新兴市场债券销售一枝独秀的一年里，墨西哥已成为发展中国家中的最大借款国，因为该国正加大力度扶持负债累累的国有石油公司墨西哥石油公司（Petroleos Mexicanos）。【原文：Mexico has become the top borrower among developing countries in a standout year for emerging market bond sales, as it ramps up efforts to prop up indebted state oil company Petroleos Mexicanos.】

item.title: 人们压力很大华盛顿特区房屋猎手因停摆而焦虑不安
item.description: 由于国民警卫队驻扎在街头，联邦工作人员休假，华盛顿的购房者们纷纷退避三舍。【原文：With National Guard troops in the streets and federal workers furloughed, house hunters in Washington are stepping back.】

item.title: 贸易和供应担忧加剧，咖啡价格再创新高
item.description: 由于对作物的担忧和美国关税再次引发了对供应的担忧，咖啡馆和超市的价格有可能进一步上涨，咖啡期货在纽约升至新的纪录。【原文：Coffee futures rose to a fresh record in New York as crop concerns and US tariffs revive worries over supplies, risking further price hikes at cafes and supermarkets.】

item.title: Blackstone 信贷资产激增 18% 后达到 5000 亿美元
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 已积累了 5,080 亿美元的信贷资产，因为这家私人资本巨头瞄准了更高等级的债务投资。【原文：Blackstone Inc. has amassed $508 billion of assets in credit as the private capital giant targets higher-grade debt investing.】

item.title: 通胀报告公布前，国债将下跌，油价大涨
item.description: 在本周万众期待的美国通胀数据公布之前，油价飙升引发了对物价增长的担忧，国债有望结束连续三日的涨势。【原文：Treasuries are poised to snap a three-day run of gains as a surge in oil prices brings price-growth concerns to the fore ahead of this week’s eagerly anticipated US inflation numbers.】

item.title: KKR 联合创始人克拉维斯认为私人信贷不存在系统性风险
item.description: KKR & Co.联合创始人亨利-克拉维斯（Henry Kravis）反驳了有关美国三色控股公司（Tricolor Holdings）和第一品牌集团（First Brands Group）的倒闭可能预示着私人信贷将面临更大麻烦的警告。【原文：KKR & Co. co-founder Henry Kravis pushed back against warnings that the collapse of Tricolor Holdings and First Brands Group in the US could herald wider trouble in private credit.】

item.title: 挪威斯托尔滕贝格称财富基金审查时机已到
item.description: 随着地缘政治紧张局势的加剧和加沙战争的爆发，挪威2.1万亿美元的主权财富基金将接受审查。【原文：Norway’s $2.1 trillion sovereign wealth fund is set to undergo a review as heightened geopolitical tensions and the war in Gaza lay bare the challenges of weighing national interest and ethics in steering the massive investor.】

item.title: 特朗普对俄罗斯石油实施的新制裁有可能将石油挤出市场
item.description:
如果印度被迫停止购买莫斯科的原油，大量石油将寻找新的买家。【原文：

A huge amount of oil will be looking for new buyers if India is forced to stop purchasing Moscow’s crude.

】

item.title: Onex 预计西捷航空将在两年内上市，此前已取得巨大收益
item.description: 投资公司 Onex Corp. 完成了向其他三家航空公司出售西捷航空 25% 股份的交易，锁定了可观的利润，该公司有望在不久的将来公开上市。【原文：Investment firm Onex Corp. expects to publicly list WestJet in the near future after it completed the sale of a 25% stake in the carrier to three other airlines to lock in a significant profit.】

item.title: 道指股价上涨，亏损收窄幅度超过分析师预期
item.description: 陶氏公司的股价在盘前交易中上涨，原因是工业部门销量的增长帮助其减少了上一季度的亏损，超出了分析师的预期。【原文：Dow Inc.’s shares rose in premarket trading as improved volumes in the industrial unit helped reduce its loss from the previous quarter more than analysts expected.】

item.title: 被债务淹没的世界中的量化宽松修正主义
item.description: 我是马尔科姆-斯科特，驻悉尼的国际经济编辑。今天我们关注财政紧张及其与央行政策的联系。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Malcolm Scott, international economics editor in Sydney.
